channel.title: Ghillie
channel.description:
Ok, so for airsoft, I'm looking to buy a ghillie suit. I've found one that seems to be the best for around the 100$ price range (as I want something a little more high quality), and I wanted to know if I get could a better one for around the same price or even a little more. I'm just looking to be fully camouflaged, and the multi layer on this one seems to be great. If you have any experience or knowledge, please post.
[url=http://www.ghilliesuitwarehouse.com/products/Ghost-Ghillie-Suit.html]http://www.ghilliesuitwarehouse.com/products/Ghost-Ghillie-Suit.html[/url]
[img]http://www.ghilliesuitwarehouse.com/product_images/l/003/woodland_ghillie_suit_1__79821_zoom.jpg[/img] [img]http://www.ghilliesuitwarehouse.com/product_images/d/955/woodland_ghillie_suit_3__79618_zoom.jpg[/img]

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:40, topic:394417”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=491603.msg3609758#msg3609758 date=1306454355]
Alright, so I just replaced the plastic orange flash hider with a nice black metal one Was a bitch though… Apparently dboys uses some damn resistant glue Took about 30 minutes with a hair dryer, a good bit of acetone (nail polish remover), quite a few q-tips, and a knife to remove all the glue & the glue residue. Looks pretty sick now though, and I was able to get the orange tip off without destroying it, so I can always swap them back if I have to
[/quote]

Black tape took me 30 seconds and has the same abilities.[/quote]
Yea, but a lot of my friends play well into the night… So eventually I’m going to save up for a tracer to throw onto the end of my gun (which your black tape can’t do :P)

Read full topic

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Frell:

succckkkss, real men play airsoft in an all black wet suit dressed as a SEAL

No lake or ocean anywhere nearby >.>
Plus, just because you have a ghillie suit doesn’t mean you’re automatically invisable. If I saw a bush moving, I’d probably shoot it.

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

So I ordered those guns last Friday, and they got here today They’re actually really nice too…

The M4 is extremely nice, only a few minor things wrong with it. The orange tip on the end of the barrel is a little crooked, but that’s coming off anyways. The wires that connect to the battery have some breakaway thing to it, and they’re exposed metal… right next to the metal barrel. Some electrical tape fixed that up nicely. The top rail system is a little loose, and one of the side ones is a little tight (its actually bending the metal a little).

I haven’t really played around with the handgun yet (had to order the green gas seperately, and it should be coming tomorrow). However, there doesn’t seem to be any major problems with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:17, topic:394417”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=491603.msg3601361#msg3601361 date=1305596906]
So I’m sitting here with about $400 in my pocket and I’m trying to make a decision… Originally the money was to buy a PS3, but I am currently leaning more towards a nice airsoft gun… Any suggestions?
[/quote]

Which one, however, I cannot help you with.[/quote]

Try these, I found them in February.

Sniper:

http://www.airgundepot.com/mauser-tactical-pro-bolt-action-airsoft-rifle.html

Galil:

http://www.airgundepot.com/galil-sar-aeg-airsoft-rifle.html

Now I’m looking more at paintball guns, better accuracy, hits harder, and you’ll know when you hit them :p.

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

m.dog311:

Nice. Around here we have large fields, surrounded by bigger forests. So my friends play in a little bit of everything. Theres a few indoor CQB airsoft places around here, but no one really uses them because its cheaper (and imo more fun) to play in the woods all day.

Yea, woods are much better then indoor places. We have a lot of forest in our area, but the “mudflats” are the easiest.

item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:27, topic:394417”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=491603.msg3601794#msg3601794 date=1305665965]
I don’t think a sight is necessary unless you’re getting a scope. Iron sights are perfectly fine up until about 100ft away.
[/quote]
I live in farm country, so a lot of what we’ll be playing in is open fields 100 ft shots are going to end up being quite common xD[/quote]
ah ok. I play in a place that, 50 years ago, was supposed to be a housing area. Lucky, they never did it, and as a result, the terrain has many hills, alot of trees, some open paths, an area we call “nam” because it’s so bushy. all good.

I’m probably going to stick with the Sig Sauer hand gun, just because I’m only going to carry the handgun as a backup, and (hopefully) not have to use it very much.

And for the optics, I think I’m going to go with this one
http://www.airsoftmegastore.com/NcStar1x30_Red_Dot_Scope_w_Flip_Up_Covers_Black_p/ncs-dtb130.htm

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Yeah The DBoys series M4 S-System is pretty decent. Instead of that pistol though I’d buy a HFC M92 Vertec, it’s around $75 for the semi-auto version only and like $80 for the full auto. Airsplat is sold out at the moment but try other retailers.

Also instead of buying green gas, if you plan on using the GBB pistol a lot, buy a propane adapter, propane tank, and lubricant separate. You’ll save money in the long run. All green gas is is propane with pre-added lubricant.

Be careful from ordering from Airsoftmegastore. I’ve done business with them and it went well, but A LOT of people have had trouble with them. If you shoot your gun once after receiving it, you automatically void their warranty as well. They also seem to lack customer service. Try ordering from Evike if they carry the same stuff (They have HOLY COW deals where you can get two extra mags for $1-$5 with the purchase of specific guns):

http://www.airsoftpost.com/advanced_search_result.php?search_in_description=1&keywords=holy+cow&Submit=Search

A gun with 350+ FPS can take heavier BBs for greater accuracy. I recommend buying .23g or .25g for that specific gun. They shouldn’t cost much more than the .2g.

Smart chargers are a great idea, so good buy there.

Optics can be expensive. I recommend going with a red/green dot sight, but I’ve never really specialized in optic manufacturers. There was a decent one for $35 somewhere where I watched reviews on, but I can’t remember where I saw it. I’ve never really seen any cheaper ACOG sights before.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I’ve been talking to a friend that does airsoft a lot, and I think this is what I’m going to get.

400 FPS DBoys Airsoft Full Metal M4 S-System RIS AEG Rifle w/ 7mm Metal Gearbox
http://www.airsoftmegastore.com/DBoys_Full_Metal_M4_S_System_RIS_AEG_Rifle_p/bi-3381m.htm?CartID=1

and my friend suggested carrying a sidearm in skirmishes, so I think I’m going with this one.

KWC Airsoft Licensed SIG SAUER P226 Gas Blowback Pistol - Competition Series - Silver
http://www.airsoftmegastore.com/KWC_Airsoft_SIG_SAUER_P226_Gas_Blowback_Pistol_p/cb-280601.htm?CartID=6

My current order (haven’t actually placed it yet) includes a few bags of .20 gram shots, a canister of green gas for the handgun, and one of those smart chargers for the AEG battery.
I’d like to include an optic, but I’m not really sure whats a good one to go with that gun, and at a relatively cheap price.
Preferably an ACOG optic. Any suggestions?

Of and I’m at about $290 right now, with (according to the site) free shipping.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Nope, have never skirmished in the snow.

I have the Well L96 sniper rifle (I think it was cheaper when I got it…maybe it rose due to CoDsofters :P) along with a WG CO2 Revolver.

http://www.airsplat.com/Items/AR-WELL-MB01BSB.htm

http://www.airsoftmegastore.com/400_FPS_WG_Full_Metal_M702_Magnum_CO2_Revolver_p/gnb-cnb702s.htm

Also have these two to finish off my current loadout:

http://www.airsplat.com/Items/ER-XL-AK47-0506.htm

http://www.airsplat.com/Items/GR-HGBB-203Z-M.htm

Also have some broken pistols, shotguns, and a miniature AUG + Pulse R76 or something from Walmart! Haha. I’ll post a picture of my loadout later on if I remember.

I’ve put a nice amount of money into airsoft, but it’s one of my favorite things to do and a great hobby. When I get older I plan on finding more professional and larger fields to play at.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:20, topic:394417”][quote author=Mack n cheese link=topic=491603.msg3601373#msg3601373 date=1305597674]
there’s nothing wrong with that… but buying a ghillie suit?
[/quote]

Airsoft snipers can play a major role in a skirmish and you must have no idea how fun ghillie suits are. Ghillie suits have other uses as well, such as scaring the shit out of people and/or hunting.

What’s the point in buying a sniper rifle if you’re sticking out of the woods like a sore thumb? Some days I regret buying mine because I don’t skirmish much in the woods, but it’s still a useful tool that I will use in the future.[/quote]

Have you ever skirmished in the snow? Me and a few buddies used to do it all winter before they moved. We all have these pure white guns. They’re awesome. Mine:

http://www.airsoftmegastore.com/PhotoGallery.asp?ProductCode=MB05A

Mine is of course painted all white but that’s the model. I’ve also got a shitty pistol for close encounters

Read full topic

What’s the point in buying a sniper rifle if you’re sticking out of the woods like a sore thumb? Some days I regret buying mine because I don’t skirmish much in the woods, but it’s still a useful tool that I will use in the future.

item.title: Ghillie
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

m.dog311:

So I’m sitting here with about $400 in my pocket and I’m trying to make a decision… Originally the money was to buy a PS3, but I am currently leaning more towards a nice airsoft gun… Any suggestions?

Depending if you’re a serious airsofter and are willing to spend that entire budget or not. If you are, head towards a Tokyo Marui. These guns are pretty much packed out of the box requiring little to no upgrades, but they are a hefty price.

If you’d like to go cheaper and are just starting out, go with JG or Echo 1. You can’t go wrong with the JG G36C:

http://www.airsplat.com/Items/ERM-JG-G36C-638.htm

It’s probably one of the most reliable and cheap guns out there. JG has good prices and usually good guns, I have an AK47 from them and have had 0 issues with it. They are easily upgradeable and it’s usually easy to find extra mags and attachments.

Others based from a budget of just $150 (Pulled off a website, always make sure to watch reviews from people who know what they’re talking about before purchasing airsoft equipment):

JG MP5 JG G36 series JG M4 KS P90 Echo 1 basic MP5 CYMA AK line CYMA M14 G&G Combat Machine (eww) JG M16

Take a look around AirsoftGI and Evike before moving onto other retailers. With $400 you can get a lot of cool stuff, but try and save some money if you want extra magazines, optics, or internal/external upgrades as well. Feel free to ask on here or PM me if you need any help or have questions regarding guns/other equipment.

Read full topic
